definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: The editorial thinking of famous men of letters in ancient China manifested Confucian orthodoxy.
sentences.chinese: 古代文化名人的編輯思想體現了中華道統。

sentences.english: People scrupulously abide by filial piety in traditional Chinese family.
sentences.chinese: 在道統的中國家庭裏，人們恪守孝道。

sentences.english: The tradition of the Way (Tao) was a very important concept in Confucianism.
sentences.chinese: 道統是儒家學派的重要概念。

definition: (Confucianism) rites and music (the means of regulating society)
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine

to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
